intro: Glaphyropteridopsis villosa, commonly known as the hairy glaphyropterid, is a rare and ancient fern-like plant belonging to the order Psilotales. It is characterized by its simple, dichotomous branching pattern and the presence of small, scale-like structures along its stems. The plant lacks true leaves and roots, relying instead on its stem for photosynthesis and nutrient absorption. It is typically found in moist, shaded environments, often in tropical or subtropical regions. Due to its primitive structure and limited distribution, it is of great interest to botanists studying plant evolution.
